DOC.detailed_description: The investigator select adult patient , 20-80yrs old ASA physical status I II , receive minor surgery , ex : breast surgery cystoscope , participate randomize cross-over trial . Patients excluded condition . The patient high risk aspiration , ex : obesity , pregnancy upper GI bleeding enough fasting time . The patient could open mouth upper airway obstruction . The patient receive major surgery , ex : heart , brain , lung , liver , kidney surgery . The patient abnormal heart lung function . The patient receive different type supraglottic airway device like proseal LMA , ambu LMA , air Q LMA igel LMA draw , patient divide different groups.In preoperative period , investigator document oropharyngeal leak pressure select position : neutral position ( 0 degree ) , rotation 15 , 30,45 , 60 degree , etc . However , oropharyngeal leak pressure measure close expiratory valve circle system fix O2 flow 3L/min 20 cm H2O . If ambu bag flattening , investigator think leakage happen laryngeal mask vocal cord . Then investigator use fiberscope observe condition epiglottis laryngeal mask . The investigator want compare mean leak pressure different head neck rotation position , ex : neutral,30,45,60 degree , use many different type supraglottic airway device . The observer define relationship epiglottis vocal cord describe condition patient different degree head neck position . Grade I vocal cord completely visible . Grade IIA partially vocal cord visible epiglottis note . Grade IIB vocal cord visible epiglottis note . Grade III condition , ex : trap epiglottis epiglottis visible .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : 2080 yr old ASA physical status I II , Receiving minor surgery , ex : breast surgery cystoscope Exclusion criterion : The patient high risk aspiration , ex : obesity , pregnancy upper GI bleeding enough fasting time . The patient could open mouth upper airway obstruction The patient receive major surgery , ex : heart , brain , lung , liver , kidney surgery . The patient abnormal heart lung function .
